description.value:
An infusion is a device that slowly injects fluid into a blood vessel. The infusion has a number of components. The infusion contains:
the (peripheral) cannula or the (central) catheter put into the patient peripherally or centrally; the administering system connected to the cannula/catheter allowing the administered fluid to run, the infusion bag containing the fluid.
Multiple administering systems may be connected to one cannula/catheter. Furthermore, a central venous catheter may have multiple lumens. Arterial and epidural catheters also exist in addition to venous catheters.

purpose.value: This DeviceUseStatement resource represents the Dutch [zib ('Zorginformatiebouwsteen', i.e. Health and Care Information Model) Infusion v4.4(2020)](https://zibs.nl/wiki/Infusion-v3.3(2020EN)).
